@CamiBe90 Hi again. There are unified EU guidelines for monitoring and reporting but not for hourly reporting for all pollutants. You can get a short overview here: https://t.co/w2iOcapUk5

@aborruso Dear Andrea... The data behind EAQI is E2a (UTD data). E1a is the YY validated measurement data reported by 30 September YY+1, being E1b the same but for modelling data. All this data can be downloaded at https://t.co/GMq8jlvFSh
I hope this clarification helps.

@CamiBe90 Dear Camilla, our air quality index is based on up-to-date (UTD) hourly measurements. Most of the Italian regions report UTD data for PM as daily data and not hourly (as can be seen in the UTD data viewer). https://t.co/j3AdelTFiz

urls.title: European Air Quality Index
urls.description: NEW MOBILE APP AVAILABLE FOR DOWNLOAD --- How clean is the air you’re breathing right now? How does the air in your city compare with that of a neighbouring city or region? Air pollution is the single largest environmental health risk in Europe. The European Environment Agency's European Air Quality Index allows users to understand more about air quality where they live. Displaying up-to-the-minute data for the whole of Europe, users can gain new insights into the air quality of individual countries, regions and cities.
